dataset.title: Macrosystems Gigante Soil Sample Data on N, P, K and Micronutrient Treated Plots - ITS Resampled

creator.organizationName: University of Oklahoma - Institute for Environmental Genomics

associatedParty.organizationName: University of Oklahoma - Kaspari Ant Lab

para.literalLayout: Patterns of biodiversity, such as the increase toward the tropics and the peaked curve during ecological succession, are fundamental phenomena for ecology. Such patterns have multiple, interacting causes, but temperature emerges as a dominant factor across organisms from microbes to trees and mammals, and across terrestrial, marine, and freshwater environments. However, there is little consensus on the underlying mechanisms, even as global temperatures increase and the need to predict their effects becomes more pressing. The purpose of this project is to generate and test theory for how temperature impacts biodiversity through its effect on biochemical processes and metabolic rate. A combination of standardized surveys in the field and controlled experiments in the field and laboratory measure diversity of three taxa -- trees, invertebrates, and microbes -- and key biogeochemical processes of decomposition in seven forests distributed along a geographic gradient of increasing temperature from cold temperate to warm tropical. This data set captures abundance of OTUs (Operational Taxonomic Units) sampled for in forest soils at the Gigante Peninsula plots in Panama. Prior to macrosystems collection, these plots had been fertilized with N, P, K, and micronutrients for 14 years. This data represents abundance of ITS (fungi) genes in soil samples at Gigante processed by the University of Oklahoma Institute for Environmental Genomics as part of a macrosystems biodiversity and latitude project supported by the National Science Foundation under Cooperative Agreement DEB#1065836.

contact.organizationName: University of Oklahoma - Institute for Environmental Genomics

para.literalLayout: This experiment was a joint effort of the Kaspari Lab and the Institute for Environmental Genomics at the University of Oklahoma. The soil samples were originally taken by the Kaspari Lab at the Gigante Peninsula plots in Panama. How does 14 years of N, P, K, and micronutrient fertilization change the diversity (species, gene) of the brown food web? How does 14 years of tree inputs, broken down by species, affect species and gene diversity? What is the relative role of tree and biogeochemistry inputs? Fertilization treatment: 40x40 m plots, 4: N, P, K, NP, NK, PK, NPK, Control, Micronutrient Tree Treatment: on each plot: 3: 1m2 litter traps, censused every 2 weeks for leaf inputs Samples: June-July 2012 Sample Size: 36*3=108 soil samples in IEC freezer, 108 invertebrate samples in Kaspari lab Files in this data set are based on resampled data (10108 sequences/sample). Taxonomic information was generated by RDP classifier (https://rdp.cme.msu.edu/classifier/classifier.jsp). GG-ITS3e-resampledOTU-sequence.fasta includes representative sequence of each OTU. GG-ITS3e-resampledOTU-sequence-aligned.fasta is the sequence file after alignment. GG-ITS3e-resampledOTU-tree-Galaxy97.nwk is phylogenetic tree file generated by FastTree. Classification information: Classifier: RDP Naive Bayesian rRNA Classifier Version 2.10, October 2014 Taxonomical Hierarchy: UNITE Fungal ITS trainset 07/04/2014 Query File: Galaxy81-[rep_seq.fasta].fasta Submit Date: Tue Jun 30 00:42:59 EDT 2015

dataTable.entityName: Macrosystems Gigante Soil Sample Data on N, P, K and Micronutrient Treated Plots - ITS Resampled
dataTable.entityDescription: This data represents relative abundance of ITS (fungi) genes in soil samples at Gigante Peninsula, Panama.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The code for each sample, representing treatment (C = control, N = nitrogen, P = phosphorus, K = potassium), plot number, and coordinates (XXX_XXX).

dataTable.entityDescription: This spreadsheet breaks down the sample codes for the abundance data to show the N, P, K, and micronutrient treatments applied to each plot and subplot.

attribute.attributeDefinition: An ID number assigned by the lab for each sample ID when stored.

textDomain.definition: An ID number assigned by the lab for each sample ID when stored.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A code made up of a letter denoting either C (control group), N (nitrogen treated), P (phosphorus treated), K (potassium treated), or M (micronutrient treated) or some combination thereof, plus a plot number and coordinates in (XXX_XXX) format.

textDomain.definition: A code made up of a letter denoting either C (control group), N (nitrogen treated), P (phosphorus treated), K (potassium treated), or M (micronutrient treated) or some combination thereof, plus a plot number and coordinates in (XXX_XXX) format.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The treatment element. Either C (control group), N (nitrogen treated), P (phosphorus treated), K (potassium treated), or M (micronutrient treated) or some combination thereof.

textDomain.definition: The treatment element. Either C (control group), N (nitrogen treated), P (phosphorus treated), K (potassium treated), or M (micronutrient treated) or some combination thereof.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The plot number

attribute.attributeDefinition: The coordinates of the treatment subplot in XXX_XXX format.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A value of 0 means that the sample area was NOT treated with Nitrogen. A value of 1 means that the sample was treated with Nitrogen.

textDomain.definition: A value of 0 means that the sample area was NOT treated with Nitrogen. A value of 1 means that the sample was treated with Nitrogen.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A value of 0 means that the sample area was NOT treated with Phosphorus. A value of 1 means that the sample was treated with Phosphorus.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A value of 0 means that the sample area was NOT treated with Potassium. A value of 1 means that the sample was treated with Potassium.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A value of 0 means that the sample area was NOT treated with Micronutrients. A value of 1 means that the sample was treated with Micronutrients.

textDomain.definition: A value of 0 means that the sample area was NOT treated with Micronutrients. A value of 1 means that the sample was treated with Micronutrients.

otherEntity.entityName: Gigante ITS Resampled Phylogenetic Tree File
otherEntity.entityDescription: Phylogenetic tree file generated by FastTree.

otherEntity.entityName: FASTA Sequence File for Gigante ITS Sampling
otherEntity.entityDescription: Includes representative sequence of each OTU. This file contains the exact sequence of the four nucleotides for each Operational Taxonomic Unit (OTU). A, C, G, and T represent the four nucleotide bases of a DNA strand — adenine, cytosine, guanine, thymine.

otherEntity.entityName: FASTA Aligned Sequence File for Gigante ITS Sampling
otherEntity.entityDescription: This file contains the exact sequence of the four nucleotides for each Operational Taxonomic Unit (OTU) after alignment. A, C, G, and T represent the four nucleotide bases of a DNA strand — adenine, cytosine, guanine, thymine.
